p: This low evenness in the Sundance Seaway is reflected in the structure of biofacies, which are often dominated by one or two species that constitute 60â€“95% of the community. Some of these species (e.g. Liostrea strigilecula and Meleagrinella curta) are found in multiple biofacies, depositional environments, and sequences, and they persisted from the initiation to the final filling of the Seaway. Other species are closely associated with a single depositional environment or sequence, such as Staffinella? sp. in the restricted shallow subtidal of J1a (biofacies M5) and Gryphaea nebrascensis in the deep shallow subtidal of J2a (biofacies M8). The few relatively diverse biofacies typically span adjacent depositional environments along an environmental gradient.
